description: A traditional, ankle-length Buddhist skirt.  The bottom protrudes, and appears in the rough shape of a triangle.
A pair of athletic shorts.  Comfortable and light.
A well-made pair of old-fashioned pants, made of stiff yet baggy material.  Comfortable, but lacks pockets.
Waterproof plastic fishing waders with a single large front pocket.
A pair of very short shorts.
A pair of fur short shorts.
A pair of hip-hugging leather short shorts.
A classic pair of denim pants.
A pair of form-fitting jeans.  There's some stretch to the fabric, but they're thinner and a little more restrictive than the normal kind.
No true Scotsman would leave home without his kilt.  Kilts lack pockets and thus a belt and sporran are necessary accessories.
Common among American nerds and rivetheads, the utility kilt is a durable canvas kilt with a large front pocket.
No true Scotsman would leave home without his kilt.
Stretchy legwear made of skin-tight spandex, sometimes used when exercising.  Some say they're pants, some say they're not.
Rags stitched together and tied into a makeshift loincloth.  Covers your modesty, but not much else.
A fur pelt tied into a loincloth.  Covers your modesty, but not much else.
Leather patches stitched together and tied into a makeshift loincloth.  Covers your modesty, but not much else.
Bits of wool stitched together and tied into a makeshift loincloth.  Covers your modesty, but not much else.
Apparently the microskirt wasn't short enough.
Loose-fitting pants ostensibly designed for exercise, though they frequently wind up as pajamas.
A pair of cotton pants.  Less durable than denim, but a little more comfortable.
A pair of cotton pants.  Less durable than denim, but a little more comfortable.

variants.description: These pants are patterned with alternating black and white squares, like a checkerboard.
A pair of pants with black and white stripes.

description: A tough pair of camouflage pants, lined with pockets.
A pair of pants lined with pockets, offering lots of storage.
A hefty pair of fur-lined pants.
A pair of long cotton pants lined with warm imitation fur.
A pair of black leather pants.  Very tough, but cumbersome and without much storage.
A pair of pants meant for alpine skiing.
A pair of tight-fitting police breeches.  They offer plenty of mobility for motorized officers.
A pair of dark blue shorts, the kind used by postal service workers.
A pair of red shorts with white trim.  For when Santa is on summer vacation.
A pair of red pants with white faux fur trim, commonly used by bearded men on Christmas.  Somewhat warm and has two deep pockets.
A pair of short pants that leave the lower legs exposed.
A pair of shorts lined with pockets, offering decent storage.
A pair of denim shorts.
A skirt made from denim.
A short, breezy cotton skirt.  Easy to move in, but only has a single small pocket.
An ankle-length skirt.
A primitive skirt made from grass.
A short leather skirt.
Durable pocketed pants made of chemical-resistant synthetics, perfect for the jobsite.
A tough pair of pants lined with pockets, thickly padded for warmth.  Favored by the military.
Loose-fitting pants made for use in martial arts.
A water-resistant pair of lightweight, flexible hiking pants with a good number of pockets.

description: Coated in more pockets than is probably either necessary or healthy and looking like they belong within a SWAT locker, these rugged combat pants possess a water-repellent coating, tough double-stitched seams, reinforced belt loops, and articulated knees.
A short skirt for the Boston-Chan costume.
